findings.message: Cross-site scripting detected in HttpServletResponse writer with variable 'param'. User input was detected going directly from the HttpServletRequest into output. Ensure your data is properly encoded using org.owasp.encoder.Encode.forHtml: 'Encode.forHtml(param)'.
findings.snippet: 1: → import javax.servlet.http.*;import org.owasp.esapi.ESAPI;import java.io.*;public class ResponseHandler{public void handle(HttpServletRequest req,HttpServletResponse res)throws IOException{String param=req.getParameter("input");String header=ESAPI.encoder().encodeForHTML("Dashboard");res.getWriter().write(param);}}

remediation.approach: Encode output, implement CSP, validate and sanitize input
remediation.validation: XSS testing with various payloads, browser security testing
remediation.risk: Client-side attacks, session hijacking, data theft, defacement

findings.message: Detected a request with potential user-input going into a OutputStream or Writer object. This bypasses any view or template environments, including HTML escaping, which may expose this application to cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. Consider using a view technology such as JavaServer Faces (JSFs) which automatically escapes HTML views.
